text: Hi, I just noticed the new (?) brand colors setting. It says that colors added will be available in all color pickers but when I check the color picker in the page editor (e.g. when setting background color for a section), it shows a row with “Favorites”. However, these are the 6 colors I’ve defined in the email settings, not the brand colors. Is this WIP or has anyone figured out how to display the brand colors in that context?

Hey Shamash, good find. This is indeed a new set of brand color settings. There’s a few areas where they’re still not actively being used, which we’re working on plugging up. The website color pickers are in development right now and should be complete pretty soon. At that point they’ll be pulling directly from this new set of account-default colors. Bit by bit the set of colors in Email Settings will be sunset and deprecated but we’ve got a few remaining steps to get there. Let me know if you’ve got any questions on it :+1:
That’s exactly what I wanted to hear :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks <@U24DCSJBE>

Why did the blog areas change it so the URLs for each blog no longer generates the blog ID in the URL? Seems like a completely unnecessary update and it was more beneficial for the Blog urls to contain the Blog IDs on the backend. For example, right now when I go to: <https://app.HubSpot.com/website/{portalID}/blog/posts> it gives me the default, but if I switched to another blog it gave me a new URL with the BlogID so I could share with the specific team that has a specific blog, I think that should be reverted back.
Anybody have experience with using HubSpot for a Chinese audience? I've read it can tank SEO and sometimes can straight up block things but I have no first hand experience.
<https://www.chooseoxygen.com/en/blog/using-HubSpot-in-china-insider-tips-for-optimal-performance>
